definition: Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools for building software applications.
Representational State Transfer - an architectural style for designing networked applications.
A specific URL where an API can be accessed and receive requests.
A type of access token that grants the bearer access to protected resources.
An open standard for access delegation, commonly used for token-based authentication.
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight data interchange format.
A formal description of the structure and constraints of data.
A request for data or information from a database or API.
Software Development Kit - a collection of tools and libraries for building applications.
Content Delivery Network - a distributed network of servers that delivers content based on geographic location.
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment - practices for automating software delivery.
A versioning scheme using MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format to convey meaning about underlying changes.
